intro: Scleranthus subuncinatus, commonly known as the slender sandparsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. It produces small, oval fruits called schizocarps, which disperse by wind. Scleranthus subuncinatus is known for its adaptability to arid environments and its role in stabilizing sandy soils.
